titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Elizabeth Vara McMurray Ellyson (1868-1958) was married to John Ellyson (1862-1911). She was the daughter of Rev. John McMurray and Kisia Elizabeth (Clamp) McMurray who died in 1880. Rev. McMurray graduated from Princeton Seminary in 1860 and moved to Texas that same year as a missionary under the charge of the Board of Domestic Missions. He was stated supply at a number of churches and also worked as a schoolmaster. In 1867 he moved to Georgetown, Texas, where he became master of the Georgetown Male and Female Academy and served as stated supply of the Georgetown Presbyterian Church in Austin. He died in 1912.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings and other memorabilia documenting the 103rd General Assembly in Detroit (1891). Rev. McMurray was a delegate representing Trinity Presbytery. The articles describe the addresses given at the Assembly, reports from various boards and committees, activities and day trips taken by attendees, and some biographical information about prominent Presbyterian ministers in attendance. The scrapbook also includes a photograph of W. Henry Green. Some of the clippings appear to be from The Herald and Presbyter and the Detroit Free Press. Elizabeth Vara McMurray accompanied her father to Detroit.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
